sub_title: Virtual Assistant - Executive Assistant & Marketing Tasks
summary:
In 2014 I decided to escape the cubicle and moved to South East Asia with the ultimate goal of being able to work from anywhere in the world. 

I spent the first seven years of my working career in marketing and before leaving South Africa was a marketing brand manager for a large investment company in Johannesburg. 

Following a year as an English Teacher in Thailand, I started my freelance career, which ultimately allowed me work and travel across Cambodia, Vietnam and Sri Lanka for three years. 

Following two years in beautiful Cape Town, I moved to The Netherlands in 2020 where I continue my remote lifestyle. My freelance focus now is working as an Executive Assistant and a Virtual Marketing Assistant. 

Freelancing for the past eight years has taught me to manage my time well and get tasks completed within tight deadlines without the need to be micro-managed.

Upwork profile: https://www.upwork.com/o/profiles/users/~01c4a02d886bee8208/

profile_positions.description:
My role as an executive assistant for the CEO and COO of a FinTech company requires attention to detail, and the ability to work under tight and quick-changing timeframes. 

My tasks include calendar management, including scheduling of internal and external meetings; inbox management; and travel arrangements. In addition I also work on planning of offsite events and various research.
profile_positions.title: Virtual Executive Assistant

profile_positions.description:
In my role as a Marketing Virtual Assistant my tasks include research and drafting of email content and crafting and scheduling of Wordpress posts. In addition I compile various email and social media stats. 

My additional tasks have also provided me with experience in multiple platforms, including Uberconference, InstantTeleseminar and Infusionsoft.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Virtual Assistant

profile_positions.description:
In 2014, I decided to quit my corporate job in South Africa and move to Thailand together with my long-term boyfriend. For the first year, I worked as an English teacher in Chiang Mai and simultaneously started freelancing in my spare time. 

After teaching for a year, we decided to travel around Southeast Asia for nine months and then settled in Cambodia for the next 2 years. 

My freelance jobs included writing industry-related articles, press releases, blog posts, newsletters and brochures for a technology blog, finance company, travel and career websites, upcycle blog and more. 

My work involves extensive research and also included ghostwriting, as well as proofreading existing content.
profile_positions.title: Freelance Writer

profile_positions.description:
I 2014 I decided to quit my corporate job and move to Thailand to teach English. After getting my TEFL certificate, I worked for a year as a Kindergarten English teacher and taught young Thai children between the ages of 3 and 6 years old. 

This position completely took me out of my comfort zone and taught me how to deal with young children, how to present in front of children as well as parents and how to impart my knowledge onto young children. I was also responsible for planning weekly lesson plans and planning activities for the children.
profile_positions.title: English Second Language Teacher

profile_positions.description:
As a marketing brand manager for Discovery Invest, I was responsible for writing content for brochures, email campaigns and the website. I also managed the Discovery Invest Facebook page, which included the day-to-day running of the page; drafting content plans and managing the design with the creative agency. 

My role also included mentoring and coaching the staff that reported to me; providing training and guidance to new team and staff members; managing product launches and large marketing projects and dealing with senior business stakeholders. I also dealt with briefing and managing timelines with the creative agency; strategic thinking that would constantly improve the Discovery Invest brand and preparing and managing the annual business division budget.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Brand Manager

profile_positions.description: As a marketing communications consultant for Discovery Invest, I managed various marketing elements, including brochures, newsletters, client communication, etc. I also had input into the creation and implementation of project plans, was responsible for managing timelines with various stakeholders and interacting with various operational business heads.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Communications Consultant

profile_positions.description: I  started my working career as a marketing assistant for PruHealth (now rebranded as VitalityHealth), a subsidiary of Discovery Ltd in the United Kingdom. As a marketing assistant I was responsible for being responsible for the first line of quality check and proof reading; monitoring deliverables against a project plan; interacting with operational business areas in order to get approval, meet business needs and maintain and build solid business relationships.
profile_positions.title: Marketing Assistant
